body_html:
It's possible with some involved usage of tf.py_func(), but we've had the feature requested enough times that it's worth adding to the Dataset.from_generator() API. An implementation is currently out for review, and it will add an optional args argument to Dataset.from_generator(), allowing you to specify tensors that should be passed to the generator function as NumPy arrays (like the inp argument to tf.py_func()).

/cc @jsimsa FYI.
body_text:
It's possible with some involved usage of tf.py_func(), but we've had the feature requested enough times that it's worth adding to the Dataset.from_generator() API. An implementation is currently out for review, and it will add an optional args argument to Dataset.from_generator(), allowing you to specify tensors that should be passed to the generator function as NumPy arrays (like the inp argument to tf.py_func()).
/cc @jsimsa FYI.
body:
It's possible with some involved usage of [`tf.py_func()`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/py_func), but we've had the feature requested enough times that it's worth adding to the `Dataset.from_generator()` API. An implementation is currently out for review, and it will add an optional `args` argument to `Dataset.from_generator()`, allowing you to specify tensors that should be passed to the generator function as NumPy arrays (like the `inp` argument to `tf.py_func()`).

/cc @jsimsa FYI.
